title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 April 2017 - XWiki
content:

09:08 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: good morning. I'm trying to run some functional tests locally and our test fwk isn't connecting to my FF (FF starts and opens up but nothing happens after that). I'm using the same version of FF as on the agents. Has anything changed recently? Thanks  
09:09 <VincentMassol[m]> actually seems to be the start of xwiki that fails  
09:10 <VincentMassol[m]> debugging  
09:10 <VincentMassol[m]> hmmm no, XWiki is started  
09:11 <VincentMassol[m]> but  
09:11 <VincentMassol[m]> 08:58:41.611 [main] INFO  o.x.test.integration.XWikiExecutor - No server is responding on [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Main/] after [120] seconds  
09:14 <VincentMassol[m]> forget that  
09:15 <VincentMassol[m]> I simply had another xwiki instance running...  
09:22 <cjd[m]> Good morning folks, if you're interested I can switch over the matrix channel as discussed before, this will end the people having names like @freenode\_cdelisle[m]:matrix.org  
09:23 <cjd[m]> and everyone will see eachothers' avatars  
09:24 <cjd[m]> What's happening right now is that Vincent, me, Pierre and Aaron are in one channel and Guillaume and Thomas are in another and these two matrix channels are both bridged to the same IRC channel so we all see what eachother are typing but it is not so pretty  
09:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <VincentMassol[m]> good morning everyone  
10:21 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm going to start the release of XWiki 8.4.5  
10:21 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <VincentMassol[m]> there's no open issues for it but if anyone knows of an important issue that would need to be in please let me know  
10:23 <VincentMassol[m]> evalica: hmm we have the 9.3 release too, can I do 8.4.5 just before, starting now?  
10:23 <sorinello> has quit  
10:24 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: have you seen this error before: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-8.4.x/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/WizardTest/testGoBackToFirstStep/ is it a flicker? Asking since it's not in jira  
10:25 <evalica> VincentMassol[m]: in order to release 9.3 we need someone to look at those tests  
10:25 <evalica> the WizardTest … it's a flicker  
10:32 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: missing doc for https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1623  
10:32 <VincentMassol[m]> (for 8.4.5)  
10:33 <VincentMassol[m]> creating RN for 8.4.5 now  
10:38 <mflorea> VincentMassol[m]: regarding the failing test, it's a test issue. The test uses getText() to see if some text is present on the page. The text that we're looking (the app name) for starts with a space and getText() removes the leading and trailing whitespace.. (as I just found out http://seleniumhq.github.io/selenium/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/WebElement.html#getText-- )  
10:40 <mflorea> I'll comment on https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1539  
11:12 <pbondoerffer[m]> good morning people

11:15 <VincentMassol[m]> welcome here Clément Aubin :)  
11:18 <evalica> hi hi :)  
11:21 <VincentMassol[m]> I hope we have enough memory on a1-1 when starting the maven build for all repos  
11:21 <VincentMassol[m]> ...

13:59 <VincentMassol[m]> by chat I mean room  
14:00 <cjd[m]> ahh  
14:00 <cjd[m]> un-q'd  
14:00 <VincentMassol[m]> thx  
14:00 <VincentMassol[m]> maybe it's @appservice-irc:matrix.org  
14:00 <VincentMassol[m]> https://solson.me/2016/10/08/irccloud-to-matrix.html  
14:01 <VincentMassol[m]> don't remember how I join that though  
14:03 <VincentMassol[m]> maybe @appservice-irc:matrix.xwiki.com  
14:04 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm no  
14:05 <cjd[m]> I tend to have an irc window available for the stuff that is not reachable from Matrix and I can just join the channel to do manual stuff if needed  
14:05 <VincentMassol[m]> maybe you didn't set this up on matrix.xwiki.com and it was setup on matrix.org  
14:06 <VincentMassol[m]> I remember very well using it  
14:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> hey so im working on application-tour  
14:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> so it seems https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/TOUR-52 already works, however it also refers to https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/TOUR-38 which would allow to switch to edit mode or a different viewer  
14:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> since we use xwiki apis to get urls, i was thinking about adding two fields to the class that has the tour to be used when generating the bootstrap-tour json: mode (/edit/) and queryParams (?viewer=attachment)  
14:33 <mflorea> pbondoerffer[m]: how do you know to open the tour on the opened/target page?  
14:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> this is retrocompatible because if the field is not set we can assume they are empty and take the default values (currently view-mode and no query params)  
14:34 <mflorea> I'm referring to the link target  
14:35 <pbondoerffer[m]> so you can specify target pages in the tour for each step  
14:36 <pbondoerffer[m]> when you load any page, it launches a xhr to a page that does an xquery which gets the tours that are relevant to the current page  
14:37 <pbondoerffer[m]> and if there is a tour for that page (handled in TourCode/TourJson), then bootstrap tour is loaded using requirejs and initialized  
14:37 <pbondoerffer[m]> and once tour.init() is called, bootstrap tour sees that it has a tour going on and does it's thing, resumes the tour  
14:37 <mflorea> that was not my question. You are on a tour step, that shows some part of the page where there are links. i.e. the tour shows your the breadcrumb. What happens if the your clicks on one of the breadcrumb links?  
14:38 <pbondoerffer[m]> oh! sorry, misunderstood  
14:39 <pbondoerffer[m]> it will likely stop the tour currently. bootstrap tour does have an option to allow a tour to continue once an event is registered on a dom element  
14:40 <mflorea> ok, so you're saying that the "move to a different page" must be made by the tour, when you click the Next button, not by clicking on some link/button on the page  
14:40 <pbondoerffer[m]> but this seems to be different from what is referenced in TOUR-52?  
14:41 <mflorea> depends, the tour step could say "Click edit to move to the next step". So the user would click the actual edit button/link on the page, not the Next step button provided by the tour  
14:43 <mflorea> this would make the tour more interactive. Otherwise, using only the Next button is more like a presentation. But maybe this is not possible or too difficult to implement at this point. But you should keep it in mind  
14:44 <pbondoerffer[m]> yeah  
14:45 <mflorea> now, even if you move to the next page using the Next button, how do you know on the next page that you are "in the middle of the tour"  
14:46 <mflorea> e.g. the tour takes you from page A to B. Maybe we don't want to show the "half" of the tour on B when you access B directly. We want to show the tour only if your come from A.  
14:46 <mflorea> also something to keep in mind  
14:46 <pbondoerffer[m]> mflorea: bootstrap tour handles that on it's own using localStorage  
14:47 <cjd> has left #xwiki  
14:47 <mflorea> ok, so the tour doesn't start on B if you access it directly?  
14:47 <VincentMassol[m]> yes it would be nice to enter in "tour mode"  
14:47 <mflorea> directly= if you click on B in the navigation tree or in the breadcrumb  
14:47 <VincentMassol[m]> and when in this mode, the tour perform checks on what you click and only allows to follow the "tutorial"  
14:47 <VincentMassol[m]> (if you click elsewhere it doesn't nothing or tell you that you're in tour mode and that you cannot click there)  
14:47 <VincentMassol[m]> s/doesnrt nothing/does nothing  
14:48 <pbondoerffer[m]> oh yeah it wont  
14:49 <pbondoerffer[m]> it will only work if you follow with the tour because it increments counters in localStorage before sending you to the relevant page  
14:49 <pbondoerffer[m]> but we can hook into events and have bootstrap tour be more interactive (ex: click on this to go to the next step)  
14:50 <pbondoerffer[m]> and hide the next button entirely by then  
14:50 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:50 <pbondoerffer[m]> http://bootstraptour.com/api/#reflex  
14:57 <mflorea> pbondoerffer[m]: back to your question, how will mode and queryParams be used exactly? Note that I'm not entirely familiar with the Tour code.  
14:58 <pbondoerffer[m]> well right now we can move to different pages but only in viewmode (we use the xwiki api to get the urls which default to view)  
14:58 <pbondoerffer[m]> the idea is to use the mode to pass it to the xwiki api to get the edit/view url (any other modes?)  
14:58 <pbondoerffer[m]> and to use the queryParams to append it to the generated URL as we have no way of doing that right now?  
15:03 <mflorea> I see. The "mode" you are referring to is called "action" in the XWiki world. For instance $xcontext.action returns "view" or "edit" or whatever is the current action. As for "queryParams", it is called "queryString" in the Java Servlet API (e.g. $request.getQueryString()). That is if you want to be in line with the XWiki naming. Otherwise what you proposed sounds good.  
15:04 <mflorea> it won't hurt to send a mail on devs mailing list saying "I'm going to add ... if anyone thinks this is wrong please reply".  
15:05 <mflorea> gdelhumeau (who wrote the tour app initially) maybe be able to reply  
15:06 <gdelhumeau> Hello  
15:06 <gdelhumeau> I actually think you don't really have the choice if you want to see edit page  
15:06 <gdelhumeau> so, indeed, the action must be given too  
15:07 <gdelhumeau> and probably the query string too  
15:07 <gdelhumeau> what I don't llke is that it make the UI of the Tour edutor more complex  
15:08 <gdelhumeau> maybe we should hide some details by default (with http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#collapse)  
15:16 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <Slashman> hello, I'm looking for a way to clone a theme to create a custom one from it, is there a way to do that? (version 8.4.4)  
15:46 <VincentMassol[m]> Slashman: sure, you go to the theme page and copy it  
15:47 <Slashman> VincentMassol[m]: yes thanks, I just found out, sorry for the stupid question :p  
15:49 <VincentMassol[m]> Slashman: np, I like when it's easy to answer :)  
15:53 <Slashman> VincentMassol[m]: I'm a little confused, is the navbar the bar at the top?  
15:54 <VincentMassol[m]> Slashman: I think that's the old termionology  
15:55 <VincentMassol[m]> where do you see this?  
15:55 <VincentMassol[m]> it's when we used to have wiki/space/page in a top level menu  
15:55 <Slashman> I'm editing the theme, and it is indeed the top bar  
15:56 <VincentMassol[m]> Caty is doing some big gardening ;)  
15:57 <Slashman> damn, the bot is spamming like crazy  
15:58 <VincentMassol[m]> yup....  
15:58 <VincentMassol[m]> so where did you see reference to the "top bar"?  
15:59 <evalica> sorry - someone copied a page with all the attachments  
15:59 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm trying to answer your "VincentMassol[m]: I'm a little confused, is the navbar the bar at the top?"  
15:59 <VincentMassol[m]> so not "top bar" but "nav bar"  
15:59 <VincentMassol[m]> I don't think there's a navbar in XWiki 8.4.4, there's a breacrumb and a nav panel  
16:00 <VincentMassol[m]> (Slashman)  
16:00 <Slashman> you see a reference to the navigation bar when you edit a theme  
16:01 <VincentMassol[m]> testing  
16:01 <VincentMassol[m]> ah indeed  
16:01 <VincentMassol[m]> it's misnamed I think  
16:02 <VincentMassol[m]> evalica: wdyt?  
16:02 <VincentMassol[m]> it seems to be the top header  
16:03 <VincentMassol[m]> so my guess is that we named at the time when we had some navbar menus  
16:03 <VincentMassol[m]> but we picked a name that's not generic enough and we removed the navbar menus and the name remained  
16:03 <evalica> our #menuview is using Bootstrap's .navbar classes  
16:03 <VincentMassol[m]> evalica: for ex: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/FlamingoThemes/Cerulean  
16:04 <evalica> the variables in the Flamingo Themes comes from Boostrap, so they are using the Boostrap terminology  
16:04 <evalica> not sure what the problem is  
16:07 <VincentMassol[m]> check my URL  
16:07 <VincentMassol[m]> the user sees on the left "Navigation Bar"  
16:07 <VincentMassol[m]> which makes no sense in XWiki  
16:07 <VincentMassol[m]> since there's no nav bar  
16:07 <VincentMassol[m]> (which is why Slashman is confused)  
16:08 <VincentMassol[m]> the only way I recognized Nav bar was the header was becase I could recognize the color !  
16:08 <VincentMassol[m]> there's absolutely no navigation in our header  
16:09 <evalica> VincentMassol[m]: that's how they are called in Bootstrap http://getbootstrap.com/components/#navbar  
16:09 <VincentMassol[m]> and?  
16:10 <VincentMassol[m]> we're xwiki not bootstrap :)  
16:10 <evalica> we are xwiki, using bootstrap  
16:10 <VincentMassol[m]> and?  
16:10 <VincentMassol[m]> again  
16:11 <evalica> and we don't duplicate the Boostrap documentation and variables, we reuse them  
16:11 <VincentMassol[m]> caty, can you put yourself in the shoes of users please  
16:11 <evalica> these users should be devs  
16:11 <VincentMassol[m]> and explain to me how someone can understand what Navigation Bar is?  
16:11 <evalica> what do you propose to copy the documentation in order to not have confusion?  
16:11 <evalica> well I don't have an answer for that, but those are variables. How can I make the variables be usable?  
16:12 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm a dev and I don't understand it. Slashman is an advanced users of xwiki for years and couldn't undestand it either  
16:12 <VincentMassol[m]> In XWiki we have several UI zones  
16:12 <VincentMassol[m]> no it's not variavles  
16:12 <VincentMassol[m]> you're confusing two things  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> you're mixing the menu on the left which lists various ui zones  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> with the variables  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> which are bootstrap varaibles  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm not suggesting to change varibles, those are technical  
16:13 <evalica> if you create an application using bootstrap's navbar, that component will have those colors  
16:13 <evalica> we are using it for our top menu  
16:13 <evalica> the theme doesn't allows you to change the color of the menu, but the color for all navbars  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> ok you know better  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> forget it  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> htere's no problme  
16:13 <VincentMassol[m]> a user says it's not undestandsable but he's plain wrong odc  
16:14 <VincentMassol[m]> ofc  
16:14 <VincentMassol[m]> he's just a user  
16:14 <VincentMassol[m]> after all  
16:14 <evalica> what do you propose?  
16:14 <VincentMassol[m]> what menu?  
16:14 <VincentMassol[m]> we're not talking about menus  
16:14 <evalica> to rename that part to what?  
16:14 <evalica> to change the variables nameS?  
16:14 <evalica> I'm talking about #menuview  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> "I'm not suggesting to change varibles, those are technical"  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> did you read what I said ?  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> this is just taking too long  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> not efficient  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> I'll let you find a solution with Slashman  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> was trying to help but apparenrtly I'm making it too complx  
16:15 <VincentMassol[m]> just come up with a solsution please  
16:16 <evalica> I cannot come with a solution if I don't see the problem  
16:16 <VincentMassol[m]> just read the thread  
16:16 <VincentMassol[m]> from the topc  
16:16 <VincentMassol[m]> \*top  
16:16 <VincentMassol[m]> Slashman asked a question  
16:19 <evalica> "is the navbar the bar at the top?" yes. #menuview that contains the logo + the global actions (search, profile, drawer) is a navbar (navigation bar). It's called like that because we are using a Boostrap component, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#navbar  
16:19 <VincentMassol[m]> (and sorry for being upset but it's been a few times where I'm trying to help our users and you keep saying that there's no problem and that it's fine the way it is and that has a tendnecy to upset me for some reason ;) So Apologies, I don't want to get mad at you; I just want to take into account our users' need with an open mind )  
16:21 <VincentMassol[m]> and how are users supposed to knw that?  
16:21 <evalica> I understand there might be confusions, but not sure what the solution would be. the theme editor is not a visual editor, but a components and variables editor. it doesn't have a 1 to 1 representation.  
16:22 <evalica> 1 solution would be to create an XWiki specific theme visual editor, but that is not easy.  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> the solutio is verys umple  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> the solutio is very simple  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> just call it with a name that represents that it is  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> just call it with a name that represents what it is  
16:22 <evalica> those variables apply to any navbar you use (maybe you add another in your application), it's not just for our 'top bar'  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> what?  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> this is an xwiki theme editor  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> and it's meant for simple users  
16:22 <VincentMassol[m]> not advanced users  
16:23 <evalica> it's not for simple users  
16:23 <VincentMassol[m]> noboyd cares about the variables  
16:23 <VincentMassol[m]> It is for simple users  
16:23 <VincentMassol[m]> definitely  
16:23 <VincentMassol[m]> and that's one of the first thing they do  
16:23 <VincentMassol[m]> when they customize their wiki  
16:24 <evalica> maybe it's intended, but it's not, since no simple user will know "@navbar-default-link-hover-bg" does, in order to change it  
16:24 <VincentMassol[m]> yes and they don't care  
16:24 <VincentMassol[m]> the user looks at the right  
16:24 <VincentMassol[m]> but they need ot know at least what part they're supposed to watch  
16:24 <evalica> I think simple user will activate a theme, not necessarily create or understand one  
16:25 <VincentMassol[m]> if you wanted to keep the name  
16:25 <VincentMassol[m]> another solution would be to overlay the name on the editor in the right  
16:25 <VincentMassol[m]> but that's more complex  
16:26 <VincentMassol[m]> they will for sure  
16:26 <VincentMassol[m]> they'll want to change the colors  
16:26 <VincentMassol[m]> to match theirs  
16:26 <VincentMassol[m]> the editor is ok  
16:27 <VincentMassol[m]> it's simple to use in general  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> do we have other pages where we use navbar caty?  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> (I mean other places than the top header)  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> ah the footer too I guess  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> trying  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> yep  
16:28 <VincentMassol[m]> anywehre else?  
16:29 <VincentMassol[m]> would "Horizontal Bars" work?  
16:29 <VincentMassol[m]> actually the menu app doesn't seem to respect navbar, is that normal evalica ?  
16:30 <evalica> that's neither XWiki nor Bootrasp terminology. Why would that be better? at least if you understand it coming from Bootstrap, you have all their documentation to help you change the variables  
16:31 <evalica> Menu app is inheriting values from the navbar using LESS. It was made before the Boostrap switch, so we didn't changed the classes, we just inherited their properties.  
16:31 <VincentMassol[m]> is Panels a boostrap term?  
16:31 <VincentMassol[m]> so it's supposed to obey navbar but isn't ATM?  
16:32 <VincentMassol[m]> it could actually be an issue if it obey navbar since there would be clear separation with header :)  
16:32 <VincentMassol[m]> it could actually be an issue if it obey navbar since there would no clear separation with header :)  
16:33 <evalica> yes - panels is also a Bootstrap term  
16:33 <VincentMassol[m]> it could actually be an issue if it obeyed navbar since there would be no clear separation with header :)  
16:33 <evalica> http://getbootstrap.com/components/#panels  
16:33 <evalica> menus using navbar variables https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-menu/xwiki-platform-menu-ui/src/main/resources/Menu/MenuMacro.xml#L629  
16:33 <VincentMassol[m]> hmmm  
16:34 <VincentMassol[m]> btw I tried to set panel-bg and it doesn't work  
16:34 <evalica> clear cache  
16:34 <evalica> and don't forget to save, the LESS parser needs to activate  
16:35 <VincentMassol[m]> no you don't need to save  
16:35 <VincentMassol[m]> it's auto refresh  
16:35 <VincentMassol[m]> it's definitely not working  
16:35 <VincentMassol[m]> (for me)  
16:35 <evalica> ok - I know, because th epreview zone is small  
16:35 <evalica> you are in mobile mode  
16:36 <evalica> can you see panels in that preview?  
16:36 <VincentMassol[m]> not really :)  
16:36 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm in 4000+ pixels horizontally :)  
16:36 <evalica> works for me  
16:36 <evalica> not sure the auto-refresh works, but the manual refresh does  
16:37 <evalica> maybe the auto has a timer
